actions.description: Verify connectivity using the configured credentials
actions.verbose: Checks that the provided bot token is valid and grabs information about the configured bot user.

example_values:
USE CATALOG SAMPLES;

SELECT
  count(*) as total_trips
FROM
  `samples`.`nyctaxi`.`trips`
WHERE
  tpep_pickup_datetime BETWEEN TIMESTAMP '{{ pickup_date.start }}'
  AND TIMESTAMP '{{ pickup_date.end }}'
  AND pickup_zip IN ({{ pickupzip }})

query_id.description: ID of the query evaluated by the alert

column.description: Name of column in the query result to compare in alert evaluation

operator.description: Operator used to compare in alert evaluation

value.description: Value used to compare in alert evaluation

muted.description: Whether or not the alert is muted

schedule_failures.description: Number of failures encountered during alert refresh. This counter is used for sending aggregated alert failure email notifications

rearm.description: Number of seconds after being triggered before the alert rearms itself and can be triggered again. If not set, alert will never be triggered again

parent.description: The identifier of the workspace folder containing the alert. The default is the user's home folder

example_values:
USE CATALOG SAMPLES;

SELECT
  count(*) as total_trips
FROM
  `samples`.`nyctaxi`.`trips`
WHERE
  tpep_pickup_datetime BETWEEN TIMESTAMP '{{ pickup_date.start }}'
  AND TIMESTAMP '{{ pickup_date.end }}'
  AND pickup_zip IN ({{ pickupzip }})

alert_id.description: ID of the alert to delete

actions.description: List all SQL warehouses for which a user has manager permissions

example_values: Status: Successfully listed warehouses, Total warehouses: 1

warehouse_id.description: Warehouse upon which to execute a statement

wait_timeout.description: The time in seconds the API service will wait for the statement's result. Can be set to 0 or to a value between 5 and 50. When set to 0 the statement will execute in asynchronous mode

on_wait_timeout.description: When in synchronous mode with wait_timeout > 0s the action taken when the timeout is reached

byte_limit.description: Applies the given byte limit to the statement's result size

catalog.description: Sets default catalog for statement execution, similar to USE CATALOG in SQL

schema.description: Sets default schema for statement execution, similar to USE SCHEMA in SQL.

example_values: SELECT concat(pickup_zip, '-', dropoff_zip) as route, AVG(fare_amount) as average_fare FROM `samples`.`nyctaxi`.`trips` GROUP BY 1 ORDER BY 2 DESC LIMIT 1000

notebook_path.description: The path of the notebook to be run in the Databricks workspace or remote repository

git_source.description: An optional specification for a remote repository containing the notebook

existing_cluster_id.description: The ID of an existing cluster to use for all runs of this task

new_cluster.description: An object specifying the details of the new cluster to use for this task

libraries.description: An optional list of libraries to be installed on the cluster that executes the task

timeout_seconds.description: An optional timeout applied to the job

run_name.description: An optional name for the run

idempotency_token.description: An optional token that can be used to guarantee the idempotency of job run requests. If a run with the provided token already exists, the request does not create a new run but returns the info of the existing run instead. If a run with the provided token is deleted, an error is returned

access_control_list.description: List of permissions to set for the run

actions.verbose: The action will ingest alerts that have been triggered within Databricks
